item.title: SanaB - Surge [Frontier Music Release, Future Bass]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
This just rolled up after listening to another Auxianâ€™s trackâ€¦

Surprised thereâ€™s been no engagement here.

Quite a simple track. The piano chord progression and the way you resolve the progression actually makes the bar count feel a little odd.

i.eâ€¦
Bar 5 feels like an extra bar added to the first progression/run-through â€“ which sounds quite satisfying.
Bar 6 sounds like an inversion of the chord from Bar 1, creating the impression that the progression has started a second run-through.
However, the progression ends just two bars later, which makes the drop feel likes itâ€™s coming in a bar early, creating the feel (to me*) that the bars are actually 5 + 3 (rather than 4 + 4)

Generally, the progression feels ambiguous.

Iâ€™m assuming the track wonâ€™t be updated, but maybe consider adding in a greater sense of build towards drops/choruses, especially when the structure isnâ€™t so standard.

 
Maybe itâ€™s just locked in my head that way now â€“ â€˜Yanny/Laurelâ€™-style â€“ and itâ€™s hard to hear if differently.

 
Btw, feels like itâ€™s really suitable for vocals.
I started mumbling vocal lines from the very first bar.

At 2â€™43", itâ€™s quite short, which makes me think thereâ€™s space for an additional bridge, where everything is stripped back to the same simplicity of the first few bars, before coming back to the drop/chorus/chords.

 
Not sure Iâ€™d call it Future Bass. The chorus/drop is definitely FB, but the main thrust of the track is a house vibe.
Future House?

I donâ€™t know enough about FB or Future House to say for sure, but my instincts say that FB isnâ€™t the right primary genre.
